14. As a consequence of every request for changes and/or additional work related to the agreed-upon subject matter, it is common and reasonable that there will be a direct impact on the need for additional time for the PLAINTIFF to extend the completion period of the work.
Furthermore, long before this lawsuit was filed, the PLAINTIFF made every reasonable effort to accommodate requests for additional or modified building designs proposed by the DEFENDANT, even in the face of pressure from the DEFENDANT toward the PLAINTIFF.
15. The request for additional or modified building designs made by the DEFENDANT to the PLAINTIFF, without a willingness to reasonably allow for extra time to complete the work, represents an unreasonable and inappropriate form of pressure, and it can be viewed as a form of moral coercion against the PLAINTIFF.
